meanings.definition: Something composed of miscellaneous or incongruous parts
meanings.sent1: The quilt was a patchwork of different fabrics and colors.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was a patchwork of ideas that didn't quite fit together.
meanings.sent3: The patchwork of jokes in the comedy show had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a patchwork of memories, some clear and some fuzzy.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a beautiful patchwork of flowers and plants.

meanings.definition: A piece of cloth made by sewing together small pieces of different fabrics
meanings.sent1: She sewed a lovely patchwork quilt for her granddaughter.
meanings.sent2: The patchwork on the tablecloth was a mix of floral patterns.
meanings.sent3: The patchwork of colors on the scarf made it unique and eye-catching.
meanings.sent4: The patchwork of patches on his jacket told a story of adventures.
meanings.sent5: The patchwork blanket kept her warm on chilly nights.

meanings.definition: To create by putting together various parts or elements
meanings.sent1: She decided to patchwork a solution using different ideas.
meanings.sent2: The artist patchworked the painting by combining different techniques.
meanings.sent3: He patchworks his meals together from various leftovers in the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The team patchworked a plan that incorporated everyone's suggestions.
meanings.sent5: She patchworks her outfits by mixing and matching different pieces.
